name: Olive Kitteridge
summary: Olive Kitteridge is a misanthropic, strict, but well-meaning, retired schoolteacher who lives in the fictional town of Crosby, Maine. She is married to Henry Kitteridge, a kind, considerate man who runs a pharmacy downtown, and has a troubled son named Christopher, who grows up to be a podiatrist. For the past thirty years, Olive has experienced problems of depression, bereavement, jealousy, and friction with family members and friends.
